pageContext.claim: “We just gave out a contract that, when it's all completed out, it'll be 115 miles.”
pageContext.analysis: A president does not award contracts like this. Trump appears to be referring to a 8-mile contract awarded in November by U.S. Customs and Border Protection and the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers for a reinforced concrete levee wall to the height of an existing levee, topped by 18-foot-tall steel bollards installed on top of the concrete wall. In other words, this is not Trump's wall but the repair and extension of existing structure. Update: After a lawsuit by the American Civil Liberities Union, a lawyer for the Trump administration told a judge on Feb. 27, 2019: "Your honor, so far as I know, there is no such contract."
